department.dept_long_name: Expository Writing, Subcommittee of the Core Program

course.title: Jane Austen, Then and Now
course.description: This course considers Austen in her own historical context and ours, and as an author whose importance lies both inside and outside the university. In our first unit, we'll undertake a close reading of Persuasion in order to assess Austen's analysis of British society at a transitional moment in its history; in unit 2 we'll consider how film and television adaptations have reinvented her best known novel, Pride and Prejudice, for a different historical moment, and in unit 3 students will engage with Austen scholarship by writing a research paper on an Austen novel or film adaption of their choice.
